title: 4 Easy Ways to Insert a Bullet Point in Adobe Photoshop

steps.title: Open a file in Photoshop.
steps.content: Open a file in Photoshop . Double-click the blue app containing Ps , click File in the menu bar, and Open… . Select a file and click Open . To create a new document, click New… in the File drop-down.

steps.title: Click the Type Tool.
steps.content: Click the Type Tool . It's the T in the Tools menu on the left side of the screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Create a text box.
steps.content: Create a text box. Drag the Type Tool to make a text box. Click the place where you want the bullet point.

steps.title: Use the keyboard shortcut.
steps.content: Use the keyboard shortcut . You'll be able to create a bullet point with the following shortcut: On Windows, press Alt + 0 + 1 + 4 + 9 . [2] X Research source On Mac, press ⌥ Option + 8 .

steps.title: Begin typing.
steps.content: Begin typing. When you enter text, the bullet point will appear to the left. Press Enter or Return to create a new line with a new bullet point.

steps.title: Open a file in Photoshop.
steps.content: Open a file in Photoshop. Double-click the blue app containing Ps , click File in the menu bar, and Open… . Select a file and click Open . To create a new document, click New… in the File drop-down.

steps.title: Click the Type Tool.
steps.content: Click the Type Tool. It's the T in the Tools menu on the left side of the screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Create a text box.
steps.content: Create a text box. Drag the Type Tool to make a text box. Click the place where you want the bullet point.

steps.title: Press L.
steps.content: Press L . This is the key that translates to a bullet point in Wingdings.

steps.title: Highlight the "l", then click the font name.
steps.content: Highlight the "l", then click the font name. You can find the font name in the upper-left corner of the window. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Type wingdings and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type wingdings and press ↵ Enter . You can also manually select Wingdings in the list. [4] X Research source The "l" will become a bullet point.

steps.title: Change the font back.
steps.content: Change the font back. Once you change the "l" to a bullet point, click the space after the bullet point. Set the font to your normal font to enter your text.

steps.title: Open a file in Photoshop.
steps.content: Open a file in Photoshop. Double-click the blue app containing Ps , click File in the menu bar, and Open… . Select a file and click Open . To create a new document, click New… in the File drop-down.

steps.title: Click the Type Tool.
steps.content: Click the Type Tool. It's the T in the Tools menu on the left side of the screen. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Create a text box.
steps.content: Create a text box. Drag the Type Tool to make a text box. Click the place where you want the bullet point.

steps.title: Copy
steps.content: Copy the bullet point. If you don't want to use a keyboard shortcut or use Wingdings, copy this bullet: • On Windows, select the bullet point and press CTRL + C to copy. On Mac, select the bullet point and press CMD + C to copy.

steps.title: Paste
steps.content: Paste the bullet point into the text box. Your bullet point will appear. On Windows, press CTRL + V to paste. On Mac, press CMD + V to paste.

steps.title: Enter your text after the bullet point.
steps.content: Enter your text after the bullet point. As long as the bullet point is in your clipboard, you can paste it as many times as needed.

steps.title: Open a file in Photoshop.
steps.content: Open a file in Photoshop. Double-click the blue app containing Ps , click File in the menu bar, and Open… . Select a file and click Open . To create a new document, click New… in the File drop-down.

steps.title: Click the Type Tool.
steps.content: Click the Type Tool. It's the T in the Tools menu on the left side of the screen. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Create a text box.
steps.content: Create a text box. Drag the Type Tool to make a text box. Click the place where you want the bullet point.

steps.title: Click Type.
steps.content: Click Type . This is in the top toolbar, between Layer and Select .

steps.title: Hover over Panels and click Glyphs Panel.
steps.content: Hover over Panels and click Glyphs Panel . It should show a checkmark when clicked. [7] X Research source A new window will open with different elements and symbols.

steps.title: Locate the bullet point.
steps.content: Locate the bullet point. You may need to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Double-click the bullet point.
steps.content: Double-click the bullet point. It will be entered directly into the text box.
